byline.contributor: Amy Chozick contributed reporting from New York.

abstract: Some Democrats are growing worried about prospect of presidential election contest between Hillary Clinton and Republican Sen Marco Rubio, with some members of Clinton's inner circle sounding alarm bells; of primary concern is degree to which Rubio, with his Hispanic background, may draw Hispanic voters to Republican Party, which has prompted Clinton to release detailed immigration plan.
lead_paragraph: They are worried that Mr. Rubio, a son of Cuban immigrants, could win over Hispanic voters and that he would offer a sharp generational contrast.

headline.main: A Hillary Clinton Match-Up With Marco Rubio Is a Scary Thought for Democrats
headline.print_headline: A Clinton Match-Up With Rubio Is a Scary Thought for Democrats

snippet: They are worried that Mr. Rubio, a son of Cuban immigrants, could win over Hispanic voters and that he would offer a sharp generational contrast.
